result.execSummary:
The defendant Talmadge E. Knight was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Talmadge E. Knight is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Talmadge E. Knight was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Talmadge E. Knight was found guilty of Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: AODA and follow through with counseling/treatment if recommended.
Random drug tests at least 1x per month.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant.
Expungement granted upon successful completion of probation.  if Defendant has even one dirty test he will not get expungement.
Defendant must successfully complete his GED program.

timeConds.notes: on or before June 6th, 2022 at 6:30 PM. Can be served on electronic monitoring.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Talmadge E. Knight

defendant.name: Knight, Talmadge E.
defendant.address: 1129 South 11th Street, Prairie du Chien, WI 53821

records.addlTxt:
3:05 PM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Talmadge E. Knight in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney David Pierce Jr. in court for Talmadge E. Knight. 

Atty. Knight files plea questionnaire with court

Atty Steiner  - ct. 1 amended to poss of TCH 961.41(3g)(e)  , and ct. 2  amended to possession of psilocybin  961.41(3g)(d)
Atty Pierce clarifies penalties for amended charges
Court clarifies agreement

Court reviews plea questionnaire/waiver of rights with def.
def. states understanding

Def. enters plea of no contest to Ct. 1 as amended   
Def. enters plea of no contest to Ct. 2 as amended 
Court accepts def 's pleas to both counts -  finds they were freely knowingly and voluntarily made and finds Def. guilty to both counts as amended

State moves to dismiss ct. 3 - Court dismisses ct. 3
 

Atty. Steiner is heard on sentences -requests sentence be withheld, 2 years probation, 2 days jail credit, $300 fine on each ct., $1686 cash collected at time of arrest - def. does not object to this being forfeited.
Atty. Pierce is heard on sentence - def. is entitled to 2 days jail credit, requests short term of probation. no fine is necessary, large amount of money is being forfeited. 

comments by defendant

3:28 PM - Court puts findings on the record. - sentences withheld def. to  2 yrs. probation on each count with same conditions - AODA and follow through with counseling/treatment if recommended, Random drug tests at least 1x per month, not to consume/possess alcohol or controlled substances, court costs, forfeit $1686 that was seized. 30 days of conditional jail to be served as a condition of probation - to be served on electronic monitoring. Def. to report on or before June 6, 2022 at 6:30 pm.
$886 court costs to be paid within 60 days.
Court will grant expungement upon successful completion of probation - if def has even one dirty test he will not get expungement.
Additional condition of probation - Def. must successfully complete his G.E.D. program.

2:33 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney David Pierce Jr. appeared by video for Talmadge E. Knight.  Def. Talmadge Knight appeared via video.
     Atty. Pierce states ready to schedule for a plea hearing; requests end of May/early June for a hearing date.
     Court concludes at 2:36 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 23, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:31 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Talmadge E. Knight appeared by video, Attorney David Pierce Jr. appeared by video for Talmadge E. Knight, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Pierce is heard, he and his client are not ready to move forward today.  Atty and Def to break out room to have further discussions.  

Atty Pierce is heard and they are ready to move forward with waiver. 

Court reviews waiver of preliminary hearing and questionnaire with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court accepts waiver and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives right to preliminary hearing. Court binds matter over for further proceedings. 

Information brought over.  Atty Pierce waives reading of the information. Defendant pleads not guilty, clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count.
Jury status hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Jury status hearing on April 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

9:15 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Talmadge E. Knight appeared by video, Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared in court for Talmadge E. Knight, Attorney David Pierce Jr. appeared by video for Talmadge E. Knight, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Erickson is withdrawing, the def has arranged for private counsel. Court allows for Atty Erickson to withdraw. 

Attorney David Pierce Jr. requests to adjourn the preliminary hearing for a later date.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on March 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 000301,
Payable Number: 70170,
Receipt Number: 22R 000452,
Amount: $20.00

3:42 PM Defendant Talmadge E. Knight appeared in court, Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Talmadge E. Knight, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court informs Def. of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Def. states understanding.  

Atty Erickson is heard.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 23, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 23, 2022 at 09:15 am.

SPD Office advises that Atty Jeffrey Erickson can take the case; however, he has a time conflict 2/8/22 at 1:30 PM and the SPD Office requested the time be moved.  JA approved - case has been moved to 3:45 PM.  SPD Office advised their client of the change in time.

2:29 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Talmadge E Knight appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause.
DA Requests signature bond of $1000.00
Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if positive submit to blood draw. 

Def comments

Court orders Signature bond of $1000.00
Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if positive submit to blood draw.

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for February 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if positive submit to blood draw.
